alphaai.apiKey.description: Your GROQ API key required for authentication.

alphaai.model.description: Selects the model utilized for generating content. Additional models can be found on the [Groq Site](https://console.groq.com/settings/limits) for more options.

alphaai.prompt.default:
### [TASK]
Document the following code. Specifically, write a jsdoc if it is a function (or similarly suitable), but if it's just normal code, write a single comment.
Extra details:
The comment may be multi-line if necessary.
If multiple functions are selected, you should write a jsdoc for the first one.
If we are in TypeScript, types in the JSDOC are unnecessary.

### [CODE]
{}

### [JSDOC or COMMENT]
alphaai.prompt.description: The prompt sent to the model. Use empty curly braces {} to signify the where your code should be inserted inside the prompt.

alphaai.maxTokens.description: Defines the maximum number of tokens to be generated per session. Increasing this limit allows for more verbose output, whereas reducing it helps manage token consumption efficiently.

alphaai.allowSingleLineSelection.description: Determines whether single-line selections are permissible for generating documentation. Although multi-line inputs typically yield superior results, enabling this option can prove beneficial for documenting concise functions or methods..

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
